answers.author: Municipal Meerkat
answers.text:
Hello Jo Ann!  Apologies for the late reply - I've been digging around to find an ordinance that suits your needs.  I've attached a regulation on animals in public buildings from Citrus County, Florida - I hope it helps!
Of course, this is an issue near and dear to me - I'm grateful for the opportunity to work in the Manager's Office every day!

answers.author: Michael Repas
answers.text:
Hi Jo Ann:
I have found another resource for you, that may be of service when considering regulations governing animals in public buildings.  I have put this document on the Knowledge Network for your ease of access.
The Attorney General of New York released a brief letter to the public explaining how and why service animals are defined, and subsequently the protection they receive under the law.  This could be a good starting point for you; the article can be found at http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301504/Service_Animals_in_Places_of_Public_Accomodation
I hope this helps!

I have found another resource for you, that may be of service when considering regulations governing animals in public buildings.  I have put this document on the Knowledge Network for your ease of access.

I hope this helps!

author: Jo Ann Gath
text:
Can you provide sample policy/procedure/protocol as it relates to animals in public buildings including or seperate to service animals and/or pets.  Can you also provide any lawsuits related to said policies/procedures/protocol.
Thank you
title: Animals in public buildings
